raw_text: The patient is complaining from bilateral knee pain since five years. Two years ago, the pain increased. Plane X-ray was done showing advanced osteoarthritis grade 4. Non-steroidal anti-inflammatory was given for around one month with muscle relaxants showing mild improvement. She is now doing physiotherapy exercises to see again after two weeks.
refined_text: The patient has been experiencing bilateral knee pain for the past five years. Two years ago, the pain worsened. A plain X-ray revealed advanced grade 4 osteoarthritis. Non-steroidal anti-inflammatory drugs were administered for approximately one month along with muscle relaxants, resulting in mild improvement. She is currently undergoing physiotherapy exercises and will be reassessed in two weeks.

Non-steroidal anti-inflammatory drugs were administered for approximately one month along with muscle relaxants, resulting in mild improvement. She is currently undergoing physiotherapy exercises and will be reassessed in two weeks.

json_data.history_of_illness: The patient has been experiencing bilateral knee pain for the past five years. Two years ago, the pain worsened.
json_data.imaging_results: A plain X-ray revealed advanced grade 4 osteoarthritis.
json_data.plan: She is currently undergoing physiotherapy exercises and will be reassessed in two weeks.

reasoning: The patient's chief complaint is bilateral knee pain, which has been ongoing for five years and worsened two years ago. The diagnosis of advanced grade 4 osteoarthritis is supported by a plain X-ray. The ICD-10 code M17.0 is appropriate for bilateral primary osteoarthritis. The patient was initially treated with non-steroidal anti-inflammatory drugs and muscle relaxants, which resulted in mild improvement. Currently, the patient is undergoing physiotherapy and is scheduled for a follow-up assessment in two weeks.
